newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish currency in circulation hits new record.
newsitem.headline: Turkish currency in circulation hits new record.

text.p: Turkey's currency in circulation hit a new all-time high of 686.1 trillion lira on Wednesday, the fourth record in a row, the central bank said on Thursday.
The new record was up 51.5 trillion lira from Tuesday's previous high of 634.6 trillion.
The recent sharp rise was caused by hefty mid-month public sector salary and pension payments and strong cash demand ahead of a 6-1/2-day holiday beginning from mid-Thursday.
Currency in circulation soared a total of 224.5 trillion lira, or 48.6 percent since last Thursday. The end-1996 figure was 382.2 trillion lira.
